page.title: 01North Central Coventry
page.content: The North Central area of Coventry reflects the local history of the City.The decline of the motor industry which once attracted migrants and overseas immigrants in search of employment has led to unemployment and population decline. The homogeneity created by migration remains and the area contains many differing life-styles and cultures, especially in the centre. It is also an area of building and architectural contrasts, ranging from shopping precincts, ring roads, high rise flats, 19th and 20th Century inner city and surburban housing, a medieval Guildhall and Cathedral, a modern Cathedral, Churches, Chapels, Mosques, Temples and a Synagogue. Remnants of the motor industry remain in smaller premises.The city centre was destroyed by bombing in World War II.
